back.text:
Root: ق و ل (Q-W-L)
Meaning: Say
Pronunciation: Qul
Tajweed Rules: Qalqalah on the 'ل' when stopping.
Derived Words:
1. قَوْل (Qawl): Saying
2. قَال (Qāla): He said
3. مَقُول (Maqūl): That which is said
4. قَائِل (Qā'il): A sayer
Example Ayah: وَقَالَ رَبُّكُمُ ادْعُونِي أَسْتَجِبْ لَكُمْ

Root: ع و ذ (`-W-DH)
Meaning: I seek refuge
Pronunciation: A'ūdhu
Tajweed Rules: Madd Tabi'i on the 'عُو'. The 'ذ' is pronounced with the tip of the tongue.
Derived Words:
1. مَعَاذ (Ma`ādh): Refuge
2. عِياذَة (`Iyādhah): Refuge-seeking
3. اسْتِعَاذَة (Isti`ādhah): Seeking protection
4. مُعِيذ (Mu`īdh): A protector
Example Ayah: فَإِذَا قَرَأْتَ الْقُرْآنَ فَاسْتَعِذْ بِاللَّهِ

hint.text: A key declaration in the Surah.

back.text:
Root: ر ب ب (R-B-B)
Meaning: In the Lord
Pronunciation: Birabb
Tajweed Rules: Tafkhīm on the 'ر' and a Shaddah on the 'ب'.
Derived Words:
1. تَرْبِيَة (Tarbiyah): Upbringing
2. رَبَّى (Rabbā): He raised
3. أَرْبَاب (Arbāb): Lords
4. رَبَّانِيّ (Rabbāniyy): Lordly
Example Ayah: بَلْدَةٌ طَيِّبَةٌ وَرَبٌّ غَفُورٌ

hint.text: Refers to the Lord of daybreak.

back.text:
Root: ف ل ق (F-L-Q)
Meaning: The daybreak, the cleaving
Pronunciation: Al-Falaq
Tajweed Rules: Alif-Lām Qamariyyah and Qalqalah on the 'ق' when stopping.
Derived Words:
1. فَلَقَ (Falaqa): He cleaved
2. اِنْفَلَقَ (Infalaqa): It was split
3. فَلِيق (Falīq): A part
4. فِلْقَة (Filqah): A piece or part
Example Ayah: فَالِقُ الْحَبِّ وَالنَّوَى

hint.text: The time of dawn, when things are cleaved from darkness.

back.text:
Root: ش ر ر (Sh-R-R)
Meaning: Evil
Pronunciation: Sharri
Tajweed Rules: Tafkhīm on the 'ر' and a Shaddah on the 'ر'.
Derived Words:
1. أَشَرّ (Asharr): More evil
2. شِرَار (Shirār): Wicked ones
3. شَرِير (Sharīr): A wicked person
4. شُرُور (Shurūr): Evils
Example Ayah: وَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ شَرًّا يَرَهُ

hint.text: The word for what we seek protection from.

back.text:
Root: خ ل ق (Kh-L-Q)
Meaning: He created
Pronunciation: Khalaq
Tajweed Rules: Tafkhīm on the 'خ' and 'ق'; Qalqalah on the 'ق' when stopping.
Derived Words:
1. خَلْق (Khalq): Creation
2. مَخْلُوق (Makhlūq): A created being
3. خَلَّاق (Khallāq): The Creator
4. أَخْلَاق (Akhlāq): Morals, character
Example Ayah: هُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ لَكُم مَّا فِي الْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا

Root: غ س ق (Gh-S-Q)
Meaning: Of darkness
Pronunciation: Ghāsiqin
Tajweed Rules: Isti'lā (heaviness) on the 'غ'. Madd Tabi'i on 'ghā'.
Derived Words:
1. غَسَق (Ghasaq): Twilight, intense darkness
2. غَسَقَ (Ghasaq): It became dark
3. إِغْسَاق (Ighsāq): The coming of darkness
4. مُغْسِق (Mughsiq): One who enters darkness
Example Ayah: إِلَىٰ غَسَقِ اللَّيْلِ

hint.text: A type of evil that comes with the night.

back.text:
Root: ع ق د (`-Q-D)
Meaning: The knots
Pronunciation: Al-`Uqad
Tajweed Rules: Alif-Lām Qamariyyah and Qalqalah on the 'ق' when stopping.
Derived Words:
1. عُقْدَة (`Uqdah): A knot
2. عَقْد (`Aqd): A contract
3. عَقَّدَ (`Aqqada): He knotted
4. مَعْقُود (Ma`qūd): Knotted
Example Ayah: أَوْفُوا بِالْعُقُودِ

hint.text: Refers to knots used in magic.

back.text:
Root: ح س د (Ḥ-S-D)
Meaning: An envier
Pronunciation: Ḥāsidin
Tajweed Rules: Madd Tabi'i on 'ḥā' for 2 counts.
Derived Words:
1. حَسَد (Ḥasad): Envy
2. حَسَدَ (Ḥasada): He envied
3. مَحْسُود (Maḥsūd): Envied
4. حَسُود (Ḥasūd): Very envious
Example Ayah: أَمْ يَحْسُدُونَ النَّاسَ عَلَىٰ مَا آتَاهُمُ اللَّهُ

hint.text: The word for one who feels envy.

back.text:
Root: ح س د (Ḥ-S-D)
Meaning: He envies
Pronunciation: Ḥasada
Tajweed Rules: Standard pronunciation, no major rules.
Derived Words:
1. حَسَد (Ḥasad): Envy
2. حَاسِد (Ḥāsid): An envier
3. مَحْسُود (Maḥsūd): Envied
4. حَسُود (Ḥasūd): Very envious
Example Ayah: وَمِن شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ
